Title: Left Ventricle in an MRI Image
Shape: Oval-like shape with thick walls tapering slightly towards the apex.
Location: Positioned on the left side of the heart, below the left atrium, and anterior to the descending aorta.
Appearance/Density: Appears hyperintense in blood-pool imaging (steady-state free precession), with myocardium appearing intermediate or dark depending on sequence.
Contour/Symmetry: Smooth and well-defined contour with symmetrical walls on both sides of the cavity.
Internal Texture: Homogeneous myocardium with visible trabeculations and papillary muscles in cine MRI sequences.

Title: Right Ventricle in an MRI Image
Shape: Crescent-shaped with thinner walls compared to the left ventricle.
Location: Located on the right side of the heart, anterior and slightly medial to the left ventricle.
Appearance/Density: Blood pool appears bright in SSFP, while the myocardium is intermediate to dark in delayed contrast imaging.
Contour/Symmetry: Less defined contour compared to the left ventricle, with asymmetrical wall thickness.
Internal Texture: Heterogeneous internal texture with prominent trabeculations along the inner surface.

Title: Left Atrium in an MRI Image
Shape: Elliptical or spherical chamber with relatively thin walls.
Location: Located superior to the left ventricle and posterior to the right atrium.
Appearance/Density: Blood pool appears hyperintense on SSFP sequences; walls enhance mildly with contrast.
Contour/Symmetry: Smooth and round contours with uniform wall thickness.

Title: Right Atrium in an MRI Image
Shape: Irregularly rounded chamber with thin walls.
Location: Positioned on the right side of the heart, inferior to the superior vena cava and anterior to the spine.
Appearance/Density: Hyperintense blood pool in steady-state imaging; walls are intermediate in intensity.
Contour/Symmetry: Smooth outer contour with occasional indentations from adjacent structures.
Internal Texture: Homogeneous texture with subtle trabeculations near the entrance of the vena cava.

Title: Myocardium of Left Ventricle in an MRI Image
Shape: Thick, continuous ring encircling the left ventricle lumen.
Location: Forms the outer wall of the left ventricle, encasing the cavity symmetrically.
Appearance/Density: Intermediate to dark in SSFP sequences; enhances with contrast in delayed imaging.
Contour/Symmetry: Smooth and well-defined contour with consistent thickness along the circumference.
Internal Texture: Homogeneous muscular texture with visible fiber orientation in certain MRI sequences.

Title: Ascending Aorta in an MRI Image
Shape: Cylindrical tubular structure with a slightly tapered superior course.
Location: Located anterior and slightly to the right of the heart, originating from the left ventricle.
Appearance/Density: Hyperintense blood pool in SSFP sequences; walls enhance with contrast.
Contour/Symmetry: Smooth and circular contour with no irregularities in healthy conditions.
Internal Texture: Homogeneous internal appearance with smooth walls and laminar flow patterns visible in phase contrast imaging.

Title: Pulmonary Artery in an MRI Image
Shape: Cylindrical tubular structure branching into left and right main pulmonary arteries.
Location: Located anterior to the left atrium and posterior to the ascending aorta.
Appearance/Density: Blood pool appears bright in SSFP sequences, while the walls may enhance with contrast.
Contour/Symmetry: Smooth and rounded contour with clear bifurcation into left and right branches.
Internal Texture: Homogeneous internal texture with laminar flow patterns visible in velocity-encoded imaging.
